intro: Lobelia ehrenbergii, commonly known as the blue lily of the valley, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial with slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant produces showy, clustered inflorescences that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Lobelia ehrenbergii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded habitats.
